title: At Mass Grave Site in Ukraine’s Northeast, a Sign of Occupation’s Toll
description: Russian troops held the city of Izium, in northeastern Ukraine, for six months. One burial site found this week could hold the remains of more than 400 people, investigators said.

title: As India Joins China in Distancing From Russia, Putin Warns of Escalation
description: After India’s prime minister said that now is not the time for war, an increasingly isolated Mr. Putin threatened “more serious” actions in Ukraine while insisting he was ready for talks.

title: Haiti’s Fuel Price Hike Escalates Its Worst Protests in Years
description: Discontent over economic misery spilled into the largest national protests in years, prompting international calls for action.

title: U.S. Immigration Debate Rings Hollow in Venezuela as Migrants Flee
description: More than a fifth of Venezuela’s population has fled the country, and critics said the move by Republican governors to ship migrants to other states would not dissuade others from leaving.

title: Ukraine is consolidating its gains, but Russia is shoring up its defensive lines, a Pentagon spokesman said.
King Charles Faces Challenges but Is Off to a Stirring Start
description: King Charles III has had an enthusiastic public reception so far, but for this man of strong opinions, replacing the beloved queen will be a challenge.

title: Desperate Clients Hold Up Lebanese Banks to Get Their Own Cash
description: The holdups are becoming increasingly common, with five on Friday alone as a financial crisis and a freeze on bank withdrawals pushes some depositors to the brink.

title: Video Reveals How Russian Mercenaries Recruit Inmates for Ukraine War
description: In a video posted on social media on Tuesday, the de facto leader of a Russian mercenary group explained to Russian convicts how they could earn their freedom by fighting in Ukraine.

title: What Ibrahim al-Nabulsi’s Killing Reveals About the West Bank
description: The life of Ibrahim al-Nabulsi, the son of a Palestinian security official, reflects some of the dynamics at play as leaders jockey to succeed Mahmoud Abbas, the Palestinian Authority president.

title: Prince William Moves Into the Spotlight as Heir to the Throne
description: Many royal watchers and historians are looking to William and his wife, Kate, who rank high in popularity polls, as the long-term future of the British monarchy.

title: India’s Leader Tells Putin That Today Is No Time for War
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s comments came a day after President Xi Jinping of China expressed muted support for Russia and steered clear in public comments of any mention of Ukraine.

title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Cancels Public Appearances After Falling Ill
description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is currently on bed rest under observation by a team of doctors, according to four people familiar with his health situation.

title: A mass grave site is found in recently reclaimed Izium.
In Hong Kong, Mourning the Queen and the Past
description: A memorial for Elizabeth has given residents of the former British colony a rare platform for public, if quiet, political dissent.

title: Ukrainian prosecutors work to document evidence of war crimes in Kharkiv.
The ‘Queue’ to View Queen Elizabeth’s Coffin Closes Temporarily
description: The British government said it would turn people away for a period of at least six hours after the volume of those waiting reached capacity.

title: Mass Grave With 440 Bodies Found in Izium, Ukraine Says
description: Investigators and prosecutors were dispatched to the site on Friday, just days after President Volodymyr Zelensky raised a flag over the reclaimed city.

title: Intense Rainstorms Leave at Least 11 Dead in Central Italy
description: The downpour was the latest in a summer of extreme weather events. Streets were turned into rivers, bridges and highways were blocked, and thousands were left without power.

title: Profiting in Congress
description: Dozens of lawmakers trade stocks related to their work, and it’s harming trust in the government.

title: In Central Asia’s ‘Great Game,’ China Seeks the Advantage
description: Xi Jinping’s visit to Central Asia this week sheds a light on his country’s efforts to increase its sway in the vast, resource-rich region once considered Russia’s domain.

title: At Old Coal Mines, the American Chestnut Tries for a Comeback
description: Across Appalachia, scientists and foresters are trying to reintroduce a hybrid version, helping to revive damaged land while also bringing back a beloved tree.

title: A mass grave site with 440 bodies was found in Izium, a police official said.
‘At the Breaking Point’: Tibetans, Under Lockdown, Make Rare Cries for Help
description: China’s ever-tightening Covid rules have prompted public complaints from residents of areas usually intimidated into keeping quiet.

title: Cultural Cringe and ‘The Lost City of Melbourne’
description: A new documentary goes some way to explaining why the city looks the way it does.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: A meeting between Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping.

title: U.S. Will Send $600 Million in Military Supplies to Ukraine
description: The new shipment continues the Pentagon’s recent trend of sending ammunition that Ukraine needs to carry out heavy fighting in the country’s south, east and northeast.

title: Putin’s admission of Chinese concerns about Ukraine isn’t a sign of a weakening bond, U.S. officials said.
